item.title: Documents Show Backpage.com Controls Sex-Related Ads
item.description: July 11, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Washington Post reporter Tom Jackman about the discovery of new documents showing that Backpage.com, a website with classified ads, controls sex-related ads on its site. The company has claimed it does not control the ads people post.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Washington Post reporter Tom Jackman about the discovery of new documents showing that Backpage.com, a website with classified ads, controls sex-related ads on its site. The company has claimed it does not control the ads people post. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/11/536699811/documents-show-backpage-com-controls-sex-related-ads

item.title: A Novelist Forces Himself To Press On After Losing 100 Pages In A Tech Glitch
item.description: July 11, 2017 - Mat Johnson's recent hard-drive failure wasn't the first time he experienced data loss. This time, despite losing more work than ever before, he's less panicked: "I can write new words," he says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - Mat Johnson's recent hard-drive failure wasn't the first time he experienced data loss. This time, despite losing more work than ever before, he's less panicked: "I can write new words," he says. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/11/534865245/a-novelist-forces-himself-to-press-on-after-losing-100-pages-in-a-tech-glitch

item.title: Anti-Social: Why Disagreements Turn Into Death Threats Online
item.description:
July 11, 2017 - The Internet is not a safe space to express opinions.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-11/anti-social-why-disagreements-turn-into-death-threats-online
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - The Internet is not a safe space to express opinions. http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-11/anti-social-why-disagreements-turn-into-death-threats-online

item.title: Internet Companies Plan Online Campaign To Keep Net Neutrality Rules
item.description: July 11, 2017 - Dozens of websites — including large ones like Netflix, Facebook and Amazon — join an online advocacy push Wednesday, urging regulators and lawmakers not to weaken regulations for Internet providers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - Dozens of websites — including large ones like Netflix, Facebook and Amazon — join an online advocacy push Wednesday, urging regulators and lawmakers not to weaken regulations for Internet providers. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/11/535804285/internet-companies-plan-online-campaign-to-keep-net-neutrality-rules

item.title: Author: Governments Seek To Dominate The 'Wild West' Of Cyberspace
item.description: July 11, 2017 - In The Darkening Web, Alexander Klimburg warns that the threat of an international cyber war is as real as nuclear exchange during the Cold War — only "many orders of magnitude greater."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - In The Darkening Web, Alexander Klimburg warns that the threat of an international cyber war is as real as nuclear exchange during the Cold War — only "many orders of magnitude greater." http://www.npr.org/2017/07/11/536595548/author-governments-seek-to-dominate-the-wild-west-of-cyberspace

item.title: Some Employers Are Rethinking Telework, Citing A Need For Better Collaboration
item.description: July 11, 2017 - Some companies find that real-time technology demands have forced them to curb their work-from-home policies, even as a growing number of employers continue to embrace remote work.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - Some companies find that real-time technology demands have forced them to curb their work-from-home policies, even as a growing number of employers continue to embrace remote work. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/11/535398716/some-employers-are-rethinking-telework-citing-a-need-for-better-collaboration

item.title: Microsoft Courts Rural America, And Politicians, With High-Speed Internet
item.description: July 11, 2017 - In rural America, 23.4 million people do not have high-speed Internet. Microsoft plans to change that, in an effort that uses cheap technology and appeals to the lowest common denominator in politics.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - In rural America, 23.4 million people do not have high-speed Internet. Microsoft plans to change that, in an effort that uses cheap technology and appeals to the lowest common denominator in politics. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/11/536559534/microsoft-courts-rural-america-and-politicians-with-high-speed-internet

item.title: Tech Design Ethicist Works To Raise Awareness Of Internet Addiction
item.description: July 10, 2017 - Former Google design ethicist Tristan Harris explains how tech companies make their products hard to resist. He now advocates for a Hippocratic Oath for tech designers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - Former Google design ethicist Tristan Harris explains how tech companies make their products hard to resist. He now advocates for a Hippocratic Oath for tech designers. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/10/536505290/tech-design-ethicist-works-to-raise-awareness-of-internet-addiction

item.title: Trump's 'Impenetrable' Cyber Unit That Never Was
item.description: July 10, 2017 - President Trump may have saved himself and the government a lot of trouble by pulling the plug on a joint cyber unit with Russia before work got seriously underway.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - President Trump may have saved himself and the government a lot of trouble by pulling the plug on a joint cyber unit with Russia before work got seriously underway. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/10/536428035/trumps-impenetrable-cyber-unit-that-never-was

item.title: Barbershop: Internet Trolling
item.description: July 8, 2017 - Host Michel Martin talks to Rants & Retorts author Anita Samuels, TrollBusters founder Michelle Ferrier and The Atlantic's Adrienne LaFrance. (LANGUAGE WARNING: The N-word is not bleeped at 3:59.)
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 8, 2017 - Host Michel Martin talks to Rants & Retorts author Anita Samuels, TrollBusters founder Michelle Ferrier and The Atlantic's Adrienne LaFrance. (LANGUAGE WARNING: The N-word is not bleeped at 3:59.) http://www.npr.org/2017/07/08/536197350/barbershop-internet-trolling

item.title: Recruiters Use 'Geofencing' To Target Potential Hires Where They Live And Work
item.description: July 7, 2017 - Geofencing sets up virtual boundaries to enable tracking of mobile devices in an area. It can be used to send coupons to customers. Now some employers are using it to target and recruit workers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 7, 2017 - Geofencing sets up virtual boundaries to enable tracking of mobile devices in an area. It can be used to send coupons to customers. Now some employers are using it to target and recruit workers. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/07/535981386/recruiters-use-geofencing-to-target-potential-hires-where-they-live-and-work

item.title: As First Model 3 Rolls Off The Line, Can Tesla Sustain Momentum?
item.description: July 7, 2017 - Tesla's first Model 3 comes off the assembly line Friday, a pivotal moment for the company. It's Tesla's mass-market electric car — with a $35,000 price. But it faces challenges ramping up production.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 7, 2017 - Tesla's first Model 3 comes off the assembly line Friday, a pivotal moment for the company. It's Tesla's mass-market electric car — with a $35,000 price. But it faces challenges ramping up production. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/07/535920505/tesla-bets-big-on-a-mass-market-electric-car

item.title: Can Snapchat's New 'Snap Map' Bring The World Closer Together?
item.description: July 6, 2017 - From cute puppies in Guatemala to daring teens in Jordan, the feature lets users share video clips and photos from their daily lives. Is that a good thing — or is it just making us all voyeurs?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 6, 2017 - From cute puppies in Guatemala to daring teens in Jordan, the feature lets users share video clips and photos from their daily lives. Is that a good thing — or is it just making us all voyeurs? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/06/535076690/can-snapchats-new-snap-map-bring-the-world-closer-together

item.title: China's Elevated Bus Project Seemed Too Good To Be True — And It Was
item.description: July 6, 2017 - Project promoters claimed a giant vehicle would beat traffic jams by straddling traffic. Last week, they were arrested on suspicion of fraud. "The idea was absurd, childish," says a longtime critic.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 6, 2017 - Project promoters claimed a giant vehicle would beat traffic jams by straddling traffic. Last week, they were arrested on suspicion of fraud. "The idea was absurd, childish," says a longtime critic. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/07/06/535625957/chinas-elevated-bus-project-seemed-too-good-to-be-true-and-it-was

item.title: Congress Casts A Suspicious Eye On Russia's Kaspersky Lab
item.description: July 5, 2017 - The renowned Russian cybersecurity firm's anti-virus software is used by millions of Americans. Congress does not want military service members to be among them.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 5, 2017 - The renowned Russian cybersecurity firm's anti-virus software is used by millions of Americans. Congress does not want military service members to be among them. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/07/05/535651597/congress-casts-a-suspicious-eye-on-russias-kaspersky-lab
